attributes.content: Mvurwi, located in Mashonaland Central Province, Zimbabwe, is a town governed by the Mvurwi Town Council. Situated in the northern part of the country, Mvurwi is known for its agricultural activities, especially tobacco and maize cultivation. The town has seen ongoing development efforts focused on enhancing infrastructure, education, and healthcare. Agriculture remains the backbone of the local economy, with Mvurwi playing a key role in Zimbabwe’s tobacco industry.

body.value: The Government of the Republic of Zambia (GRZ) recognizes the significant contribution of the Zambian diaspora to national development, as reflected in the Seventh National Development Plan and accordingly formulated a national Diaspora Policy which was launched in April 2019. attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Zimbabwe Energy Regulatory Authority (ZERA) is a body corporate established in terms of the Energy Regulatory Authority Act  of 2011. It is mandated to regulate the entire energy sector in Zimbabwe in a fair, transparent, efficient and cost effective manner for the benefit of the consumers and energy suppliers. ZERA derives its mandate from the Energy Regulatory Authority Act of 2011 read together with the Electricity Act no 4 of 2002, the Petroleum Act of 2006 and subsequent amendments.

body.value: The Zimbabwe Energy Regulatory Authority (ZERA) is a body corporate established in terms of the Energy Regulatory Authority Act  of 2011. It is mandated to regulate the entire energy sector in Zimbabwe in a fair, transparent, efficient and cost effective manner for the benefit of the consumers and energy suppliers. ZERA derives its mandate from the Energy Regulatory Authority Act of 2011 read together with the Electricity Act no 4 of 2002, the Petroleum Act of 2006 and subsequent amendments. ZERA regulates the Zimbabwean energy market cost effectively, through incentive regulation and in a fair and transparent manner to achieve sustainable energy.

body.value:
Chariot is an Africa-focused transitional energy group with three main business streams: Transitional Gas, Transitional Power, and Green Hydrogen.

Chariot Transitional Gas is dedicated to a high-value, low-risk gas development project offshore Morocco. This project operates in a rapidly growing emerging economy and offers a clear path to early monetization, positive cash flow, and significant exploration potential.

attributes.content: The Lufubu Power Company Limited (LPC) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Lufubu Power Company Limited (LPC) is a fully Zambian-owned private company established in 2012. As an Independent Power Producer, LPC focuses on developing a hydropower scheme within the Lufubu River basin, situated between the Mpulungu and Nsama districts in Zambia's Northern Province. The company’s initial project involves a hydropower-based electricity generating facility aimed at providing power to both the local community and the national grid.

body.value: The Lufubu Power Company Limited (LPC) is a fully Zambian-owned private company established in 2012. As an Independent Power Producer, LPC focuses on developing a hydropower scheme within the Lufubu River basin, situated between the Mpulungu and Nsama districts in Zambia's Northern Province. The company’s initial project involves a hydropower-based electricity generating facility aimed at providing power to both the local community and the national grid. The generated electricity will be transmitted to the nearest national grid connection point, in coordination with the national grid operator.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: H.E. Jackson Engineering was established in 1923 in Zimbabwe, by Major Herbert Edward Jackson. The need arose to branch out regionally and in 2009 Premier Steel and Engineering Ltd (PSE) was formed in Malawi. Its more centrally located position allowed the company to become operational in other neighbouring countries, such as Zambia and Mozambique. attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Housing Corporation (NHC) is a statutory body established under an Act of Parliament, Cap. 117, with the primary mandate of playing a principal role in the implementation of the Government of Kenya’s housing policies and programs.

body.value:
The National Housing Corporation (NHC) is a statutory body established under an Act of Parliament, Cap. 117, with the primary mandate of playing a principal role in the implementation of the Government of Kenya’s housing policies and programs.

The origins of the NHC trace back to 1953 when the Colonial Government of Kenya established the Central Housing Board through the Housing Ordinance. This Board served as the main vehicle for promoting the development of housing for Africans during the colonial era. In 1959, the Board's activities were expanded to include housing initiatives for Europeans and Asians, reflecting the broader needs of the population.

By 1965, the Board took on the responsibility of directly constructing dwellings in areas where local authorities were either unable or unwilling to do so. In the same year, an amendment to the Housing Ordinance of 1953 led to the establishment of the National Housing Corporation (NHC), replacing the Central Housing Board and solidifying its role as the key institution in the housing sector.

This Board served as the main vehicle for promoting the development of housing for Africans during the colonial era. By 1965, the Board took on the responsibility of directly constructing dwellings in areas where local authorities were either unable or unwilling to do so. Over the decades, L&B has grown into a leading global aviation consulting firm, offering specialized services that cater to the unique demands of the aviation industry.

Recognizing the international and dynamic nature of aviation, L&B places great importance on maintaining a strong local and regional presence through its global network of offices, while also leveraging the benefits of its extensive international experience. The firm is proud to have contributed to projects on all seven continents, including many of the world’s largest and most complex airports.

attributes.content: Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation (KFIC) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation (KIFC), is a state corporation established under the Legal Notice No. 214 of the State Corporation Act (Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation Order, 2018).

body.value:
Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation (KIFC), is a state corporation established under the Legal Notice No. 214 of the State Corporation Act (Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation Order, 2018).

Kenya fisheries are predominantly artisanal but with big potential in the offshore and the Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) which remains largely unexploited. At present most exploitation is by artisanal and semi – industrial inshore fisheries, the fishermen lack the capacity in terms of skills and the appropriate fishing vessels that can venture into the offshore/deep sea fishery. The country’s offshore waters have been exploited over the years by distant water fishing vessels from Europe and Asia, visiting the region to fish for tunas and billfishes. Recently in efforts to build local fishing fleet a number of fishing vessels have arrived on mainly joint ventures but still we have a long way to go to achieve maximum utilization of our waters.

body.value:
TPS Eastern Africa PLC is a prominent Kenya-based company specializing in the ownership and operation of hotel and lodge facilities across East Africa. Serving both the business and tourist markets, TPS Eastern Africa is recognized as a leading hospitality brand, offering a diverse range of accommodation, holiday, and conference solutions, as well as cultural heritage and adventure tourism experiences.

The company operates approximately 35 hotels, resorts, safari lodges, camps, palaces, and forts, strategically located in East Africa, including Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar, Rwanda, Mozambique, and the Democratic Republic of Congo, as well as in South Asia, with properties in Pakistan, Afghanistan, and Tajikistan. Among its renowned properties are the Nairobi Serena Hotel, Serena Beach Resort and Spa in Mombasa, Amboseli Serena Safari Lodge, Mara Serena Safari Lodge, and Mbuzi Mawe Serena Camp, among others.

attributes.content: The Government of Uganda is a presidential representative democratic republic. The President is both the head of state and government, elected for a five-year term. The unicameral Parliament consists of 459 members. The judiciary is independent, and Uganda operates under a multi-party system with occasional challenges to political freedoms. Local governments play a significant role in governance, and the economy is predominantly agrarian with emerging sectors like oil production.

attributes.content: The Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) was established by the U.S. Congress in January 2004 with broad bipartisan support to provide foreign aid to some of the world's poorest countries. MCC partners with countries that demonstrate a commitment to just and democratic governance, economic freedom, and investments in their populations. The corporation’s unique approach focuses on investing in well-governed countries, ensuring that development dollars are used effectively and incentivizing reform even before a country is selected for partnership.

attributes.content: The Government of Comoros is the executive authority responsible for the administration and governance of the Comoros Islands, an archipelago located in the Indian Ocean. It oversees various aspects of national development, including economic growth, public services, and infrastructure. The government operates under a federal system, with a Union Government overseeing national matters and individual island governments managing local issues. Its key functions include formulating policies, implementing development programs, and ensuring the welfare of its citizens.

attributes.content: The Société d’Exploitation du Transgabonais (SETRAG) is a Gabonese company responsible for the operation and management of the Transgabonais railway line. This railway line is crucial for transporting goods, particularly minerals, from the interior of Gabon to the port of Libreville. SETRAG's primary functions include maintaining and operating the railway infrastructure, ensuring efficient freight transportation, and contributing to the country's economic development through the enhancement of logistics and transportation networks.

Its two basic constitutive documents are the Establishment Agreement, which gives it the status of an international organization, and the Charter, which governs its corporate structure and operations.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of National Housing and Social Amenities in Zimbabwe is responsible for developing and implementing housing policies. It plays a crucial role in providing adequate housing and social amenities to citizens. According to the Constitution (Amendment Number 20 of 2013, Section 28), the Ministry ensures access to both home ownership and rental options. Home ownership can be obtained through outright purchase or rent-to-buy schemes from government, local authorities, or the private sector, with security provided by title deeds.

The Ministry supports Vision 2030, aiming for a prosperous, upper-middle-income society by 2030.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Victoria Falls is a small town situated in the north-west corner of Zimbabwe and rests comfortably in the Zambezi Valley just a few hundred meters from the south bank of one of Southern Africa’s great rivers, the Zambezi which meanders through Mozambique right into the Indian Ocean. At this point of the river are the mighty, world famous Victoria Falls, on the Zimbabwe-Zambia boarder.

body.value: Victoria Falls is a small town situated in the north-west corner of Zimbabwe and rests comfortably in the Zambezi Valley just a few hundred meters from the south bank of one of Southern Africa’s great rivers, the Zambezi which meanders through Mozambique right into the Indian Ocean. At this point of the river are the mighty, world famous Victoria Falls, on the Zimbabwe-Zambia boarder. The Victoria Falls or Mosi-Oa-Tunya (The smoke that thunders) is where the mighty Zambezi river suddenly plunges into a narrow gorge of over 100 meters deep, forming one of the world’s largest and most beautiful waterfalls with millions of gallons of water plunging over a 1,7 km-wide cliff.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: National Railways of Zimbabwe | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Railways of Zimbabwe (NRZ) is a statutory body established by an Act of Parliament and is wholly owned by the Government of Zimbabwe. It operates in compliance with public sector regulations and is mandated to provide competitive bulk rail transportation services for freight and passengers. Founded in 1897, NRZ manages a rail network of 2,760 route kilometers with a 1,067mm gauge track. Strategically located, it serves as a key hub and gateway to the Southern Africa Development Community (SADC) region.

body.value: The National Railways of Zimbabwe (NRZ) is a statutory body established by an Act of Parliament and is wholly owned by the Government of Zimbabwe. It operates in compliance with public sector regulations and is mandated to provide competitive bulk rail transportation services for freight and passengers. Founded in 1897, NRZ manages a rail network of 2,760 route kilometers with a 1,067mm gauge track. Strategically located, it serves as a key hub and gateway to the Southern Africa Development Community (SADC) region. The NRZ network is linked to Mozambique via the Mutare/Machipanda border posts to Beira and the Sango/Chicualacuala route to Maputo. It connects to South Africa through Beitbridge, Botswana via Plumtree, and Victoria Falls to Zambia.

attributes.content: Over the span of four decades, Tractionel Enterprise has pioneered breakthroughs in railway electrification projects, carving out a unique niche catering to PRASA, Transnet, and private siding owners. This remarkable journey has led to diversification into high voltage works, substations, overhead transmission lines, and township electrification projects.

body.value:
Over the span of four decades, Tractionel Enterprise has pioneered breakthroughs in railway electrification projects, carving out a unique niche catering to PRASA, Transnet, and private siding owners. This remarkable journey has led to diversification into high voltage works, substations, overhead transmission lines, and township electrification projects.

Since its acquisition by Enza Construction, Tractionel Enterprise has undergone a remarkable transformation. With a rich legacy of technical excellence spanning decades, it has evolved into an empowered entity, aligning its mission and values with those of its parent company, Enza Construction. Both Enza Construction and Tractionel Enterprise share a family-owned ethos, a distinctive culture, and a business approach centered on meticulous attention to detail, profound impact, and an unwavering commitment to stakeholders across the spectrum – from employees and clients to shareholders.

attributes.content: Binga Rural District Council is a Binga based company or business offering Government & Parastatals in Zimbabwe.The Binga Rural District Council (BRDC) is the local government authority for the Binga District in Zimbabwe's Matabeleland North Province. Tasked with overseeing local governance, development, and service delivery, BRDC addresses the needs of its predominantly rural communities. body.value: Binga Rural District Council is a Binga based company or business offering Government & Parastatals in Zimbabwe.The Binga Rural District Council (BRDC) is the local government authority for the Binga District in Zimbabwe's Matabeleland North Province. Tasked with overseeing local governance, development, and service delivery, BRDC addresses the needs of its predominantly rural communities. The council manages administrative functions, implements development projects, and provides essential services like water supply, sanitation, and waste management. body.processed: Binga Rural District Council is a Binga based company or business offering Government & Parastatals in Zimbabwe.The Binga Rural District Council (BRDC) is the local government authority for the Binga District in Zimbabwe's Matabeleland North Province. Tasked with overseeing local governance, development, and service delivery, BRDC addresses the needs of its predominantly rural communities. The council manages administrative functions, implements development projects, and provides essential services like water supply, sanitation, and waste management. It supports local economic activities, particularly agriculture, and promotes community welfare through social and cultural programs. Overall, BRDC plays a key role in enhancing the development and quality of life in Binga District.

attributes.content: European Union-Africa Infrastructure Trust Fund (EUAITF) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Established in 2007 through collaboration between the European Commission and European Union Member States, the EU-Africa Infrastructure Trust Fund (EU-AITF) has played a pivotal role in boosting infrastructure investment across Sub-Saharan Africa. The fund achieves this by combining long-term loans from participating financiers with grant resources from donors, focusing on four key sectors: water, energy, transport, and ICT. This approach aims to enhance infrastructure development and foster sustainable economic growth in the region.

attributes.content: Established in 2000 by Billy Galal, Nala Consulting Engineers stands out as one of Johannesburg’s pioneering Black Economic Empowerment consulting engineering firms, with extensive experience across Africa on major projects like the Vodacom Campus and OR Tambo International Airport Mu

body.value: Established in 2000 by Billy Galal, Nala Consulting Engineers stands out as one of Johannesburg’s pioneering Black Economic Empowerment consulting engineering firms, with extensive experience across Africa on major projects like the Vodacom Campus and OR Tambo International Airport Multi-Storey Parkade. Following Galal’s retirement in 2018, the company has been led by seasoned engineer Dean Pillay. Nala Consulting Engineers is committed to investing in its employees through competitive wages, good working conditions, and career advancement. The firm is relationship-oriented, prioritizing customer satisfaction by proactively identifying and resolving potential issues before construction begins. Recognized by Eskom as an Energy Saving Company, Nala Consulting Engineers also maintains a robust safety program that benefits both employees and clients.
